name.@value: Nori Sprout Rolls with Ginger Tamarindo Sauce

recipeIngredient.@value: ½ teaspoon pink or sea salt
¾ of a medium avocado, sliced
Pink or sea salt to taste
Fresh ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup spring or filtered water (more or less as needed)
4-6 leaves of Boston lettuce (or other soft leaved lettuce)

recipeInstructions.@value: Place the Nori sheet on a dry flat surface. Place the Boston lettuce on the sheet. Then make a bed of alfalfa sprouts up to three quarters of the width of the wrap covering the wrap lengthwise.
Add avocado, sweet potato, and cucumber down the wrap lengthwise but close to the edge.
Meanwhile rinse the Boston lettuce leaves and set on a tea towel to dry. Slice the lettuce in half down the middle.

After the wrap is loaded, carefully fold and roll it so it is a long roll. Before getting to the end, wet your finger with some water and run it along the bottom edge. Then finish rolling and smooth the bottom edge to make it stick.
Take an organic sweet potato and peel it. Then cut into strips and gently steam until tender. Drain and set aside to cool.
Peel the cucumber and slice into long strips. Remove the avocado from its skin and cut into strips also.
Put the sauce in a separate bowl and serve immediately.
Do the same for the second Nori sheet. After the two rolls are prepared, slice them into equal pieces with a sharp knife across the roll. Flip them up so you see the inside onto a plate.
Add all the sauce ingredients to a blender.
